title: Shakespeare's The Merchant of Venice dir by Trevor Nunn (2004)
description:
William Shakespeare's The Merchant Of Venice (2004)
A Royal National Theatre production

Run time 141 min.

Cast
	
Henry Goodman,         Shylock
David Bamber,          Antonio
Derbhle Crotty,        Portia
Peter De Jersey,       Salerio
Mark Umbers,           Solanio
Alexander Hanson,      Bassanio
Jack James,            Lorenzo
Richard Henders,       Gratiano
Alex Kelly.            Nerissa

Full cast in the Credits of the play

Creatives 

Directed for the stage by       Trevor Nunn
Director of photography,        Paul Wheeler
Editor,                         Roger Wilson  
Line producer,                  Andy Picheta 
Music composed and arranged by  Steven Edis

"Produced in association with The Lexington Road Entertainment Group, 
British Broadcasting, Sveriges Television, DCD Media."

Summary

   Shylock loans money to a man he despises, the merchant Antonio, only if a pound of Antonio's flesh will be due, in a court of law, upon default. Antonio borrows the money so that his friend Bessanio can travel to woo the woman he loves, Portia, whose freedom to marry is bound up in a fairy-tale decree of her father's.

My notes

   A request from a friend prompted me to post this 2004 Merchant of Venice.  The setting is Germany in the Weimar Republic era of the cabaret entertainments.  

   Merchant of Venice has, of course one,  of the  great "trouser roles" which have become famous in Shakespeare here as in the RSC "Two Gentlen of Verona".  Two Gentlemen can be found in this collection in my TPB.


   Please report any problem with playback.  A previous item I posted did not open properly
